p: Using MEM, the average epidemic length was 16.5 weeks (95% CI: 14.0–18.0), covering 92.9% (95% CI: 90.2–95.3%) of all RSV detections during the season. Using the predefined threshold of 1.2%, the average epidemic period typically lasted 16.0 weeks (95%CI: 13.6–18.4) and covered 91.5% (95% CI: 87.7–95.4%) of all RSV detections.
